Line 22: Line 22:
Ubuntu-Eee is an independent project to create a [[Linux distribution|distribution]] based on [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] optimized to run on the [[Asus Eee PC]] netbook. It's an operating system, using the [[Ubuntu Netbook Remix | Netbook Remix]] interface, which favors the best software available instead of open source alternatives (ie. [[Skype]] instead of [[Ekiga]]).
Ubuntu-Eee is an independent project to create a [[Linux distribution|distribution]] based on [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] optimized to run on the [[Asus Eee PC]] netbook. It's an operating system, using the [[Ubuntu Netbook Remix | Netbook Remix]] interface, which favors the best software available instead of open source alternatives (ie. [[Skype]] instead of [[Ekiga]]).
â
== Trademark Dispute ==
+
== Trademark issues ==
On September 10th, Canonical emailed Jon Ramvi, the main developer of the project, complaining the project's use of Canonical's names, URLs, and logos violates Canonical's trademarks.<ref>[http://www.jonramvi.com/mail-from-canonical/ Mail from Canonical]</ref> The owners of the project have not yet announced a new name.
On September 10th, Canonical emailed Jon Ramvi, the main developer of the project, complaining the project's use of Canonical's names, URLs, and logos violates Canonical's trademarks.<ref>[http://www.jonramvi.com/mail-from-canonical/ Mail from Canonical]</ref> The owners of the project have not yet announced a new name.
